channel.title: Comments on: My first Cluster running on Windows
channel.description: Database technologies - especially around scalability and High Availability

item.title: By: Kailas Gorane
item.dc:creator: Kailas Gorane
item.description:
Hi Andrew, I am referring to this tutorial to setup mySql cluster. But, sqlserver node is not coming up. Below is output from mgmt console -
[ndbd(NDB)] 2 node(s) id=2 @10.15.4.30 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0, *) id=3 @10.15.4.34 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0)
[ndb_mgmd(MGM)] 1 node(s) id=1 @10.15.4.48 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5)
[mysqld(API)] 2 node(s) id=4 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.36) id=5 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.47)
My config.ini file is configured as below-
[ndbd default] noofreplicas=2 [ndbd] hostname=10.15.4.30 NodeId=2 [ndbd] hostname=10.15.4.34 NodeId=3 [ndb_mgmd] NodeId = 1 hostname=10.15.4.48 DataDir=E:/mysqlcluster/cluster-logs #Directory of the management node Log files [mysqld] NodeId=4 hostname=10.15.4.36 [mysqld] NodeId=5 hostname=10.15.4.47
Below is the my.cnf file on 10.15.4.36 - [mysqld] ndb-nodeid=4 ndbcluster Ndb-connectstring=10.15.4.48 port=3306 server-id=3306
Could you please reply to this issue?
item.content:encoded:
Hi Andrew,
I am referring to this tutorial to setup mySql cluster. But, sqlserver node is not coming up. Below is output from mgmt console –

[ndbd(NDB)] 2 node(s)
id=2 @10.15.4.30 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0, *)
id=3 @10.15.4.34 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5, Nodegroup: 0)

[ndb_mgmd(MGM)] 1 node(s)
id=1 @10.15.4.48 (mysql-5.7.17 ndb-7.5.5)

[mysqld(API)] 2 node(s)
id=4 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.36)
id=5 (not connected, accepting connect from 10.15.4.47)

My config.ini file is configured as below-

[ndbd default]
noofreplicas=2
[ndbd]
hostname=10.15.4.30
NodeId=2
[ndbd]
hostname=10.15.4.34
NodeId=3
[ndb_mgmd]
NodeId = 1
hostname=10.15.4.48
DataDir=E:/mysqlcluster/cluster-logs #Directory of the management node Log files
[mysqld]
NodeId=4
hostname=10.15.4.36
[mysqld]
NodeId=5
hostname=10.15.4.47

Below is the my.cnf file on 10.15.4.36 –
[mysqld]
ndb-nodeid=4
ndbcluster
Ndb-connectstring=10.15.4.48
port=3306
server-id=3306

Could you please reply to this issue?

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-cluster/my-first-cluster-running-on-windows#comment-23210">saor</a>.
The best way to setup MySQL Cluster on Windows these days is to use the auto-installer - see <a href="/mysql-cluster/mysql-cluster-7-3-auto-installer" title="MySQL Clusrer Auto-Installer" target="_blank" rel="nofollow">MySQL Cluster 7.3 GA – Includes MySQL Cluster Auto-Installer</a>.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to saor.

The best way to setup MySQL Cluster on Windows these days is to use the auto-installer – see MySQL Cluster 7.3 GA – Includes MySQL Cluster Auto-Installer.

item.title: By: saor
item.dc:creator: saor
item.description:
why i can still cant find this directory from my instalation even i have folder alredy visible ??
Copy the contents of “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data” to “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data4″, “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data5″ and “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data6″. Note that this assumes that you’ve already made hidden files visible. Each of these folders will be used by one of the mysqld processes.
My Version Sql Cluster is 7.3.3
thx for helping me.
item.content:encoded:
why i can still cant find this directory from my instalation even i have folder alredy visible ??

Copy the contents of “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data” to “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data4″, “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data5″ and “C:ProgramDataMySQLMySQL Server 7.0data6″. Note that this assumes that you’ve already made hidden files visible. Each of these folders will be used by one of the mysqld processes.

My Version Sql Cluster is 7.3.3

thx for helping me.

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-cluster/my-first-cluster-running-on-windows#comment-20678">Gaurav</a>.
Gaurav,
double check that the mysqld you're using is one that came as part of a MySQL Cluster package - this error suggests that you're using a "reguar" mysqld instead.
Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Gaurav.

Gaurav,

double check that the mysqld you’re using is one that came as part of a MySQL Cluster package – this error suggests that you’re using a “reguar” mysqld instead.

Andrew.

item.title: By: Gaurav
item.dc:creator: Gaurav
item.description:
Hi Andrew
Thanks for your effort for explaining the cluster setup, I successfully configured mysql cluster with the help of you tutorial.
Regards Gaurav
item.content:encoded:
Hi Andrew

Thanks for your effort for explaining the cluster setup,
I successfully configured mysql cluster with the help of you tutorial.

Regards
Gaurav

item.title: By: Gaurav
item.dc:creator: Gaurav
item.description:
Hi Andrew I tried to create cluster but I am facing issue to run api node here is error log 131201 3:44:10 [Note] Plugin 'FEDERATED' is disabled. 131201 3:44:11 InnoDB: Started; log sequence number 0 44233 131201 3:44:11 [ERROR] mysqld: unknown variable 'ndb-nodeid=4' 131201 3:44:11 [ERROR] Aborting
---------------------------- ndb_mgm> show Cluster Configuration --------------------- [ndbd(NDB)] 2 node(s) id=2 @127.0.0.1 (mysql-5.1.72 ndb-7.1.29, Nodegroup: 0, *) id=3 @127.0.0.1 (mysql-5.1.72 ndb-7.1.29, Nodegroup: 0)
[ndb_mgmd(MGM)] 1 node(s) id=1 @127.0.0.1 (mysql-5.1.72 ndb-7.1.29)
[mysqld(API)] 3 node(s) id=4 (not connected, accepting connect from localhost) id=5 (not connected, accepting connect from localhost) id=6 (not connected, accepting connect from localhost)
Thanks
item.content:encoded:
Hi Andrew
I tried to create cluster but I am facing issue to run api node
here is error log
131201 3:44:10 [Note] Plugin ‘FEDERATED’ is disabled.
131201 3:44:11 InnoDB: Started; log sequence number 0 44233
131201 3:44:11 [ERROR] mysqld: unknown variable ‘ndb-nodeid=4’
131201 3:44:11 [ERROR] Aborting

—————————-
ndb_mgm> show
Cluster Configuration
———————
[ndbd(NDB)] 2 node(s)
id=2 @127.0.0.1 (mysql-5.1.72 ndb-7.1.29, Nodegroup: 0, *)
id=3 @127.0.0.1 (mysql-5.1.72 ndb-7.1.29, Nodegroup: 0)

[ndb_mgmd(MGM)] 1 node(s)
id=1 @127.0.0.1 (mysql-5.1.72 ndb-7.1.29)

[mysqld(API)] 3 node(s)
id=4 (not connected, accepting connect from localhost)
id=5 (not connected, accepting connect from localhost)
id=6 (not connected, accepting connect from localhost)

Thanks

item.title: By: andrew
item.dc:creator: andrew
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/mysql-cluster/my-first-cluster-running-on-windows#comment-82">Karen</a>.
Hi Karen,
at present, there is no MSI available and so you'll have to use the zip.
Best Regards, Andrew.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Karen.

Hi Karen,

at present, there is no MSI available and so you’ll have to use the zip.

Best Regards, Andrew.

item.title: By: Karen
item.dc:creator: Karen
item.description:
There is no .MSI file in the installation pacakge. just a zip package.
Is there a way to install it using the MSI? I am just wondering if the MSI is missing
item.content:encoded:
There is no .MSI file in the installation pacakge. just a zip package.

Is there a way to install it using the MSI? I am just wondering if the MSI is missing

item.title: By: Omar
item.dc:creator: Omar
item.description: sorry correction: the output of the last "show" command is: id=6 @192.x.x.x (…, starting,nodegroup:0) id=25 (not connected, accepting connect from 192.x.x.x)
item.content:encoded:
sorry correction: the output of the last “show” command is:
id=6 @192.x.x.x (…, starting,nodegroup:0)
id=25 (not connected, accepting connect from 192.x.x.x)

item.title: By: Omar
item.dc:creator: Omar
item.description:
Thank you very much for your support!! highly appreciated, the problem has been solved, but another problem arised. I have two data nodes first one with nodeid=6 and the other one with nodeid=25, when I first started I typed the command "ndbd --initial" and the angle was connected and allocated correctly, then I typed the "show" command on the Managment node and the results where: id=6 @192.x.x.x (..., starting,nodegroup:0) id=6 @192.x.x.x (..., starting,nodegroup:0) then it shows a message: node 25:forced shutdown completed. occuring during startphase 0, Initiated by single 9 and when I typed the "show command again this was the status: id=6 @192.x.x.x (..., starting,nodegroup:0) id=6 (not connected, accepting connect from 192.x.x.x) so how can I resolve this issue. thank you for your support
best regards, omar
item.content:encoded:
Thank you very much for your support!! highly appreciated, the problem has been solved, but another problem arised. I have two data nodes first one with nodeid=6 and the other one with nodeid=25, when I first started I typed the command “ndbd –initial” and the angle was connected and allocated correctly, then I typed the “show” command on the Managment node and the results where:
id=6 @192.x.x.x (…, starting,nodegroup:0)
id=6 @192.x.x.x (…, starting,nodegroup:0)
then it shows a message:
node 25:forced shutdown completed. occuring during startphase 0, Initiated by single 9
and when I typed the “show command again this was the status:
id=6 @192.x.x.x (…, starting,nodegroup:0)
id=6 (not connected, accepting connect from 192.x.x.x)
so how can I resolve this issue.
thank you for your support

best regards,
omar
